divorce.translation[0].definitions[0].de: the legal ending of a marriage
divorce.translation[0].definitions[0].no: file/sue/petition for divorce (=start the legal divorce process)
divorce.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Why doesn’t she get a divorce?
One in three marriages ends in divorce.
His wife has started divorce proceedings.
the rise in the divorce rate
She received the house as part of the divorce settlement  (=the amount of money, property etc each person receives in a divorce case).
The Act extended the grounds  (=legal reasons) for divorce.
divorce.translation[0].definitions[1].de: the fact of separating two related things
divorce.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: the divorce between theory and method
divorce.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: Their marriage had never been happy and in the end they got a divorce.
I was going through a divorce and it was a very painful time.
She told him she wanted a divorce.
She asked her husband for a divorce after he had been unfaithful.
Five years later, their marriage ended in divorce.
The next day I saw a lawyer and filed for a divorce.
After a long and bitter divorce, Wendy was looking forward to starting a new life.
She wanted to avoid a messy divorce .
I have been through a painful divorce, and know what it feels like.
The country has a high divorce rate.
His first marriage was unsuccessful and led to long divorce proceedings.
She received a $10 million divorce settlement from her first husband.
It was the biggest divorce case that an English court has dealt with.
She's a famous New York divorce lawyer.
My husband refused to sign the divorce papers.
Violence and neglect are grounds for divorce.
divorce.translation[1].definitions[0].de: if someone divorces their husband or wife, or if two people divorce, they legally end their marriage
divorce.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: David’s parents divorced when he was six.
My father threatened to divorce her.
divorce.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to separate two ideas, subjects etc completely
divorce.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: It is difficult to divorce sport from politics.
divorce.translation[1].definitions[2].de: to stop being involved in an activity, organization, situation etc
divorce.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: Our society has divorced itself from religion.
divorce.translation[1].note_box[0].items: Divorce is a reciprocal verb This type of verb is used when saying that two or more people or things do something that involves both or all of them    This suggests it was mainly the decision of one person to end the marriage
divorce.translation[1].note_box[1].secti: After seven years, they decided to divorce.
She divorced him six months after they were married.
to start to live apart from your husband or wife because of problems in your marriage
They argued all the time and in the end agreed to separate.
She separated from her husband and moved to a flat in London.
to end a marriage or a romantic relationship
When Andy was nine, his parents split up.
He's just broken up with his girlfriend.
to stop living with your husband, wife, or partner, often because you are having a relationship with someone else
Her husband left her for a younger woman after 27 years of marriage.
